Concept.name: Assets
Concept.label: Assets
Concept.description: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all assets that are recognized. Assets are probable future economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past transactions or events.

Concept.name: AssetsCurrent
Concept.label: Assets, Current
Concept.description: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all assets that are expected to be realized in cash, sold, or consumed within one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer). Assets are probable future economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past transactions or events.

Concept.name: CashAndCashEquivalentsAtCarryingValue
Concept.label: Cash and Cash Equivalents, at Carrying Value
Concept.description: Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Excludes cash and cash equivalents within disposal group and discontinued operation.

Concept.name: CashCashEquivalentsAndShortTermInvestments
Concept.label: Cash, Cash Equivalents, and Short-term Investments
Concept.description: Cash includes currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. It also includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits in that the customer may deposit additional funds at any time and effectively may withdraw funds at any time without prior notice or penalty. Cash equivalents, excluding items classified as marketable securities, include short-term, highly liquid Investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash, and so near their maturity that they present minimal risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Generally, only investments with original maturities of three months or less qualify under that definition. Original maturity means original maturity to the entity holding the investment. For example, both a three-month US Treasury bill and a three-year Treasury note purchased three months from maturity qualify as cash equivalents. However, a Treasury note purchased three years ago does not become a cash equivalent when its remaining maturity is three months. Short-term investments, exclusive of cash equivalents, generally consist of marketable securities intended to be sold within one year (or the normal operating cycle if longer) and may include trading securities, available-for-sale securities, or held-to-maturity securities (if maturing within one year), as applicable.

Children.Label: Restricted Cash And Cash Equivalents Current

Concept.name: RestrictedCashAndCashEquivalentsAtCarryingValue
Concept.label: Restricted Cash and Cash Equivalents, Current
Concept.description: Amount of cash and cash equivalents restricted as to withdrawal or usage, classified as current. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Concept.name: RestrictedCashCurrent
Concept.label: Restricted Cash, Current
Concept.description: Amount of cash restricted as to withdrawal or usage, classified as current. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits.

Concept.name: RestrictedCashAndInvestmentsCurrent
Concept.label: Restricted Cash and Investments, Current
Concept.description: The current cash, cash equivalents and investments that are restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Restrictions may include legally restricted deposits held as compensating balances against short-term borrowing arrangements, contracts entered into with others, or entity statements of intention with regard to particular deposits; however, time deposits and short-term certificates of deposit are not generally included in legally restricted deposits. Excludes compensating balance arrangements that are not agreements which legally restrict the use of cash amounts shown on the balance sheet. Includes current cash equivalents and investments that are similarly restricted as to withdrawal, usage or disposal.

Concept.name: MarketableSecuritiesCurrent
Concept.label: Marketable Securities, Current
Concept.description: Amount of investment in marketable security, classified as current.

Concept.name: ShortTermInvestments
Concept.label: Short-term Investments
Concept.description: Amount of investments including trading securities, available-for-sale securities, held-to-maturity securities, and short-term investments classified as other and current.

Concept.name: DeferredOfferingCosts
Concept.label: Deferred Offering Costs
Concept.description: Specific incremental costs directly attributable to a proposed or actual offering of securities which are deferred at the end of the reporting period.

Concept.name: InventoryFinishedGoods
Concept.label: Inventory, Finished Goods, Gross
Concept.description: Amount before valuation and LIFO reserves of completed merchandise or goods expected to be sold within one year or operating cycle, if longer.

Concept.name: InventoryNet
Concept.label: Inventory, Net
Concept.description: Amount after valuation and LIFO reserves of inventory expected to be sold, or consumed within one year or operating cycle, if longer.

Concept.name: InventoryWorkInProcess
Concept.label: Inventory, Work in Process, Gross
Concept.description: Amount before valuation and LIFO reserves of merchandise or goods in the production process expected to be completed within one year or operating cycle, if longer.

Children.Label: [G]Accounts and Financing Receivable, after Allowance for Credit Loss, Current
[G]Accounts Receivable, after Allowance for Credit Loss, Current

Concept.name: AccountsReceivableNetCurrent
Concept.label: Accounts Receivable, after Allowance for Credit Loss, Current
Concept.description: Amount, after allowance for credit loss, of right to consideration from customer for product sold and service rendered in normal course of business, classified as current.

Children.Label: [G]Financing Receivable, after Allowance for Credit Loss, Current

Concept.name: NotesAndLoansReceivableNetCurrent
Concept.label: Financing Receivable, after Allowance for Credit Loss, Current
Concept.description: Amount, after allowance for credit loss, of financing receivable, classified as current. Includes, but is not limited to, notes and loan receivable.

Concept.name: DeferredIncomeTaxAssetsNet
Concept.label: Deferred Income Tax Assets, Net
Concept.description: Amount, after allocation of valuation allowances and deferred tax liability, of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible differences and carryforwards, with jurisdictional netting.

Concept.name: FinanceLeaseRightOfUseAsset
Concept.label: Finance Lease, Right-of-Use Asset, after Accumulated Amortization
Concept.description: Amount, after accumulated amortization, of right-of-use asset from finance lease.

Concept.name: Goodwill
Concept.label: Goodwill
Concept.description: Amount after accumulated impairment loss of an asset representing future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognized.

Concept.name: FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsAccumulatedAmortization
Concept.label: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Accumulated Amortization
Concept.description: Accumulated amount of amortization of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life.

Concept.name: FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsGross
Concept.label: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Gross
Concept.description: Amount before amortization of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life.

Concept.name: FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsNet
Concept.label: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Net
Concept.description: Amount after amortization of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life.

Concept.name: IndefiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsExcludingGoodwill
Concept.label: Indefinite-lived Intangible Assets (Excluding Goodwill)
Concept.description: Amount of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance and having a projected indefinite period of benefit.

Concept.name: IntangibleAssetsNetExcludingGoodwill
Concept.label: Intangible Assets, Net (Excluding Goodwill)
Concept.description: Sum of the carrying amounts of all intangible assets, excluding goodwill, as of the balance sheet date, net of accumulated amortization and impairment charges.

Children.Label: [G]Accounts and Financing Receivable, after Allowance for Credit Loss, Noncurrent

Concept.name: LongTermAccountsNotesAndLoansReceivableNetNoncurrent
Concept.label: Accounts and Financing Receivable, after Allowance for Credit Loss, Noncurrent
Concept.description: Amount, after allowance for credit loss, of accounts and financing receivables, classified as noncurrent. Includes, but is not limited to, notes and loan receivable.

Concept.name: OperatingLeaseRightOfUseAsset
Concept.label: Operating Lease, Right-of-Use Asset
Concept.description: Amount of lessee's right to use underlying asset under operating lease.

Concept.name: OtherAssetsNoncurrent
Concept.label: Other Assets, Noncurrent
Concept.description: Amount of noncurrent assets classified as other.

Concept.name: AccumulatedDepreciationDepletionAndAmortizationPropertyPlantAndEquipment
Concept.label: Accumulated Depreciation, Depletion and Amortization, Property, Plant, and Equipment
Concept.description: Amount of accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization for physical assets used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services.

Concept.name: PropertyPlantAndEquipmentGross
Concept.label: Property, Plant and Equipment, Gross
Concept.description: Amount before accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization of physical assets used in the normal conduct of business and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, and furniture and fixtures.

Concept.name: PropertyPlantAndEquipmentNet
Concept.label: Property, Plant and Equipment, Net
Concept.description: Amount after accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization of physical assets used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, and furniture and fixtures.

Concept.name: UnamortizedDebtIssuanceExpense
Concept.label: Unamortized Debt Issuance Expense
Concept.description: The remaining balance of debt issuance expenses that were capitalized and are being amortized against income over the lives of the respective bond issues. This does not include the amounts capitalized as part of the cost of the utility plant or asset.

Concept.name: RestrictedCashAndCashEquivalentsNoncurrent
Concept.label: Restricted Cash and Cash Equivalents, Noncurrent
Concept.description: Amount of cash and cash equivalents restricted as to withdrawal or usage, classified as noncurrent. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Concept.name: RestrictedCashNoncurrent
Concept.label: Restricted Cash, Noncurrent
Concept.description: Amount of cash restricted as to withdrawal or usage, classified as noncurrent. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits.

Concept.name: Liabilities
Concept.label: Liabilities
Concept.description: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all liabilities that are recognized. Liabilities are probable future sacrifices of economic benefits arising from present obligations of an entity to transfer assets or provide services to other entities in the future.

Concept.name: AccountsPayableCurrent
Concept.label: Accounts Payable, Current
Concept.description: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of liabilities incurred (and for which invoices have typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received that are used in an entity's business. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

Concept.name: AccruedLiabilitiesCurrent
Concept.label: Accrued Liabilities, Current
Concept.description: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable, pertaining to costs that are statutory in nature, are incurred on contractual obligations, or accumulate over time and for which invoices have not yet been received or will not be rendered. Examples include taxes, interest, rent and utilities. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

Concept.name: EmployeeRelatedLiabilitiesCurrent
Concept.label: Employee-related Liabilities, Current
Concept.description: Total of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred through that date and payable for obligations related to services received from employees, such as accrued salaries and bonuses, payroll taxes and fringe benefits. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

Concept.name: TaxesPayableCurrent
Concept.label: Taxes Payable, Current
Concept.description: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable for statutory income, sales, use, payroll, excise, real, property and other taxes. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

Concept.name: AccruedEnvironmentalLossContingenciesCurrent
Concept.label: Accrued Environmental Loss Contingencies, Current
Concept.description: Carrying value of the obligation (known or estimated) arising from requirements to perform activities to remediate one or more sites, payable in twelve months or in the next operating cycle if longer.

Concept.name: DebtCurrent
Concept.label: Debt, Current
Concept.description: Amount of short-term debt and current maturity of long-term debt and capital lease obligations due within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

Concept.name: FinanceLeaseLiabilityCurrent
Concept.label: Finance Lease, Liability, Current
Concept.description: Present value of lessee's discounted obligation for lease payments from finance lease, classified as current.

Concept.name: LongTermDebtAndCapitalLeaseObligationsCurrent
Concept.label: Long-term Debt and Lease Obligation, Current
Concept.description: Amount of long-term debt and lease obligation, classified as current.

Concept.name: ConvertibleDebtCurrent
Concept.label: Convertible Debt, Current
Concept.description: The portion of the carrying value of long-term convertible debt as of the balance sheet date that is scheduled to be repaid within one year or in the normal operating cycle if longer. Convertible debt is a financial instrument which can be exchanged for a specified amount of another security, typically the entity's common stock, at the option of the issuer or the holder.

Concept.name: LongTermDebtCurrent
Concept.label: Long-term Debt, Current Maturities
Concept.description: Amount, after unamortized (discount) premium and debt issuance costs, of long-term debt, classified as current. Includes, but not limited to, notes payable, bonds payable, debentures, mortgage loans and commercial paper. Excludes capital lease obligations.

Concept.name: ConvertibleNotesPayableCurrent
Concept.label: Convertible Notes Payable, Current
Concept.description: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the portion of long-term debt due within one year or the operating cycle if longer identified as Convertible Notes Payable. Convertible Notes Payable is a written promise to pay a note which can be exchanged for a specified amount of another, related security, at the option of the issuer and the holder.

Concept.name: ContractWithCustomerLiabilityCurrent
Concept.label: Contract with Customer, Liability, Current
Concept.description: Amount of obligation to transfer good or service to customer for which consideration has been received or is receivable, classified as current.

Concept.name: DeferredRevenueCurrent
Concept.label: Deferred Revenue, Current
Concept.description: Amount of deferred income and obligation to transfer product and service to customer for which consideration has been received or is receivable, classified as current.

Concept.name: LiabilitiesCurrent
Concept.label: Liabilities, Current
Concept.description: Total obligations incurred as part of normal operations that are expected to be paid during the following twelve months or within one business cycle, if longer.

Concept.name: OtherLiabilitiesCurrent
Concept.label: Other Liabilities, Current
Concept.description: Amount of liabilities classified as other, due within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

Children.Label: Liabilities Other Than Long Term Debt Noncurrent

Concept.name: AccruedEnvironmentalLossContingenciesNoncurrent
Concept.label: Accrued Environmental Loss Contingencies, Noncurrent
Concept.description: Carrying value of the obligation (known or estimated) arising from requirements to perform activities to remediate one or more sites, payable after twelve months or beyond the next operating cycle if longer.

Concept.name: AssetRetirementObligationsNoncurrent
Concept.label: Asset Retirement Obligations, Noncurrent
Concept.description: Noncurrent portion of the carrying amount of a liability for an asset retirement obligation. An asset retirement obligation is a legal obligation associated with the disposal or retirement of a tangible long-lived asset that results from the acquisition, construction or development, or the normal operations of a long-lived asset, except for certain obligations of lessees.

Concept.name: DeferredRentCreditNoncurrent
Concept.label: Deferred Rent Credit, Noncurrent
Concept.description: For a classified balance sheet, the cumulative difference between the rental income or payments required by a lease agreement and the rental income or expense recognized on a straight-line basis, or other systematic and rational basis more representative of the time pattern in which use or benefit is granted or derived from the leased property, expected to be recognized in income or expense, by the lessor or lessee, respectively, more than one year after the balance sheet date.

Concept.name: ContractWithCustomerLiabilityNoncurrent
Concept.label: Contract with Customer, Liability, Noncurrent
Concept.description: Amount of obligation to transfer good or service to customer for which consideration has been received or is receivable, classified as noncurrent.

Concept.name: DeferredRevenueNoncurrent
Concept.label: Deferred Revenue, Noncurrent
Concept.description: Amount of deferred income and obligation to transfer product and service to customer for which consideration has been received or is receivable, classified as noncurrent.

Children.Label: Derivative Instruments And Hedges Liabilities Noncurrent

Concept.name: DerivativeLiabilitiesNoncurrent
Concept.label: Derivative Liability, Noncurrent
Concept.description: Fair value, after the effects of master netting arrangements, of a financial liability or contract with one or more underlyings, notional amount or payment provision or both, and the contract can be net settled by means outside the contract or delivery of an asset, expected to be settled after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer. Includes assets not subject to a master netting arrangement and not elected to be offset.

Concept.name: OperatingLeaseLiabilityNoncurrent
Concept.label: Operating Lease, Liability, Noncurrent
Concept.description: Present value of lessee's discounted obligation for lease payments from operating lease, classified as noncurrent.

Concept.name: OtherLiabilitiesNoncurrent
Concept.label: Other Liabilities, Noncurrent
Concept.description: Amount of liabilities classified as other, due after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

Concept.name: FinanceLeaseLiabilityNoncurrent
Concept.label: Finance Lease, Liability, Noncurrent
Concept.description: Present value of lessee's discounted obligation for lease payments from finance lease, classified as noncurrent.

Concept.name: LongTermDebtAndCapitalLeaseObligations
Concept.label: Long-term Debt and Lease Obligation
Concept.description: Amount of long-term debt and lease obligation, classified as noncurrent.

Concept.name: ConvertibleDebtNoncurrent
Concept.label: Convertible Debt, Noncurrent
Concept.description: Carrying amount of long-term convertible debt as of the balance sheet date, net of the amount due in the next twelve months or greater than the normal operating cycle, if longer. The debt is convertible into another form of financial instrument, typically the entity's common stock.

Concept.name: LongTermDebtNoncurrent
Concept.label: Long-term Debt, Excluding Current Maturities
Concept.description: Amount after unamortized (discount) premium and debt issuance costs of long-term debt classified as noncurrent and excluding amounts to be repaid within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer. Includes, but not limited to, notes payable, bonds payable, debentures, mortgage loans and commercial paper. Excludes capital lease obligations.

Concept.name: LongTermLoansPayable
Concept.label: Loans Payable, Noncurrent
Concept.description: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of loans payable (with maturities initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle if longer), excluding current portion.

Concept.name: ConvertibleLongTermNotesPayable
Concept.label: Convertible Notes Payable, Noncurrent
Concept.description: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of long-term debt (with maturities initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle if longer) identified as Convertible Notes Payable, excluding current portion. Convertible Notes Payable is a written promise to pay a note which can be exchanged for a specified amount of another, related security, at the option of the issuer and the holder.

Concept.name: LiabilitiesAndStockholdersEquity
Concept.label: Liabilities and Equity
Concept.description: Amount of liabilities and equity items, including the portion of equity attributable to noncontrolling interests, if any.

Children.Label: Limited Liability Company LLC Members Equity Including Portion Attributable To Noncontrolling Interest
Limited Liability Company LLC Members Equity

Concept.name: AccumulatedOtherComprehensiveIncomeLossNetOfTax
Concept.label: Accumulated Other Comprehensive Income (Loss), Net of Tax
Concept.description: Accumulated change in equity from transactions and other events and circumstances from non-owner sources, net of tax effect, at period end. Excludes Net Income (Loss), and accumulated changes in equity from transactions resulting from investments by owners and distributions to owners. Includes foreign currency translation items, certain pension adjustments, unrealized gains and losses on certain investments in debt and equity securities, other than temporary impairment (OTTI) losses related to factors other than credit losses on available-for-sale and held-to-maturity debt securities that an entity does not intend to sell and it is not more likely than not that the entity will be required to sell before recovery of the amortized cost basis, as well as changes in the fair value of derivatives related to the effective portion of a designated cash flow hedge.

Concept.name: RetainedEarningsAccumulatedDeficit
Concept.label: Retained Earnings (Accumulated Deficit)
Concept.description: The cumulative amount of the reporting entity's undistributed earnings or deficit.

Children.Label: [G]Partners' Capital, Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest
[G]Accumulated Other Comprehensive Income (Loss), Net of Tax

Concept.name: AccumulatedOtherComprehensiveIncomeLossNetOfTax
Concept.label: Accumulated Other Comprehensive Income (Loss), Net of Tax
Concept.description: Accumulated change in equity from transactions and other events and circumstances from non-owner sources, net of tax effect, at period end. Excludes Net Income (Loss), and accumulated changes in equity from transactions resulting from investments by owners and distributions to owners. Includes foreign currency translation items, certain pension adjustments, unrealized gains and losses on certain investments in debt and equity securities, other than temporary impairment (OTTI) losses related to factors other than credit losses on available-for-sale and held-to-maturity debt securities that an entity does not intend to sell and it is not more likely than not that the entity will be required to sell before recovery of the amortized cost basis, as well as changes in the fair value of derivatives related to the effective portion of a designated cash flow hedge.

Concept.name: RetainedEarningsAccumulatedDeficit
Concept.label: Retained Earnings (Accumulated Deficit)
Concept.description: The cumulative amount of the reporting entity's undistributed earnings or deficit.

Children.Label: [G]Equity, Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest

Concept.name: MinorityInterest
Concept.label: Stockholders' Equity Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest
Concept.description: Total of all stockholders' equity (deficit) items, net of receivables from officers, directors, owners, and affiliates of the entity which is directly or indirectly attributable to that ownership interest in subsidiary equity which is not attributable to the parent (that is, noncontrolling interest, previously referred to as minority interest).

Children.Label: [G]Accumulated Other Comprehensive Income (Loss), Net of Tax

Concept.name: AccumulatedOtherComprehensiveIncomeLossNetOfTax
Concept.label: Accumulated Other Comprehensive Income (Loss), Net of Tax
Concept.description: Accumulated change in equity from transactions and other events and circumstances from non-owner sources, net of tax effect, at period end. Excludes Net Income (Loss), and accumulated changes in equity from transactions resulting from investments by owners and distributions to owners. Includes foreign currency translation items, certain pension adjustments, unrealized gains and losses on certain investments in debt and equity securities, other than temporary impairment (OTTI) losses related to factors other than credit losses on available-for-sale and held-to-maturity debt securities that an entity does not intend to sell and it is not more likely than not that the entity will be required to sell before recovery of the amortized cost basis, as well as changes in the fair value of derivatives related to the effective portion of a designated cash flow hedge.

Concept.name: AdditionalPaidInCapital
Concept.label: Additional Paid in Capital
Concept.description: Excess of issue price over par or stated value of the entity's capital stock and amounts received from other transactions involving the entity's stock or stockholders. Includes adjustments to additional paid in capital. Some examples of such adjustments include recording the issuance of debt with a beneficial conversion feature and certain tax consequences of equity instruments awarded to employees. Use this element for the aggregate amount of additional paid-in capital associated with common and preferred stock. For additional paid-in capital associated with only common stock, use the element additional paid in capital, common stock. For additional paid-in capital associated with only preferred stock, use the element additional paid in capital, preferred stock.

Concept.name: AdditionalPaidInCapitalCommonStock
Concept.label: Additional Paid in Capital, Common Stock
Concept.description: Value received from shareholders in common stock-related transactions that are in excess of par value or stated value and amounts received from other stock-related transactions. Includes only common stock transactions (excludes preferred stock transactions). May be called contributed capital, capital in excess of par, capital surplus, or paid-in capital.

Concept.name: CommonStockValue
Concept.label: Common Stock, Value, Issued
Concept.description: Aggregate par or stated value of issued nonredeemable common stock (or common stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer). This item includes treasury stock repurchased by the entity. Note: elements for number of nonredeemable common shares, par value and other disclosure concepts are in another section within stockholders' equity.

Concept.name: PreferredStockValue
Concept.label: Preferred Stock, Value, Issued
Concept.description: Aggregate par or stated value of issued nonredeemable preferred stock (or preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer). This item includes treasury stock repurchased by the entity. Note: elements for number of nonredeemable preferred shares, par value and other disclosure concepts are in another section within stockholders' equity.

Concept.name: RetainedEarningsAccumulatedDeficit
Concept.label: Retained Earnings (Accumulated Deficit)
Concept.description: The cumulative amount of the reporting entity's undistributed earnings or deficit.

Concept.name: StockholdersEquity
Concept.label: Stockholders' Equity Attributable to Parent
Concept.description: Total of all stockholders' equity (deficit) items, net of receivables from officers, directors, owners, and affiliates of the entity which are attributable to the parent. The amount of the economic entity's stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the amount of stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in subsidiary equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling interest, minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes called permanent equity.

Concept.name: StockholdersEquityIncludingPortionAttributableToNoncontrollingInterest
Concept.label: Stockholders' Equity, Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest
Concept.description: Amount of stockholders' equity (deficit), net of receivables from officers, directors, owners, and affiliates of the entity, attributable to both the parent and noncontrolling interests. Amount excludes temporary equity. Alternate caption for the concept is permanent equity.

Children.Label: [G]Temporary Equity, Carrying Amount, Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interests

Concept.name: RedeemableNoncontrollingInterestEquityCarryingAmount
Concept.label: Redeemable Noncontrolling Interest, Equity, Carrying Amount
Concept.description: As of the reporting date, the aggregate carrying amount of all noncontrolling interests which are redeemable by the (parent) entity (1) at a fixed or determinable price on a fixed or determinable date, (2) at the option of the holder of the noncontrolling interest, or (3) upon occurrence of an event that is not solely within the control of the (parent) entity. This item includes noncontrolling interest holder's ownership (or holders' ownership) regardless of the type of equity interest (common, preferred, other) including all potential organizational (legal) forms of the investee entity.

Concept.name: TemporaryEquityCarryingAmountAttributableToParent
Concept.label: Temporary Equity, Carrying Amount, Attributable to Parent
Concept.description: Carrying amount, attributable to parent, of an entity's issued and outstanding stock which is not included within permanent equity. Temporary equity is a security with redemption features that are outside the control of the issuer, is not classified as an asset or liability in conformity with GAAP, and is not mandatorily redeemable. Includes any type of security that is redeemable at a fixed or determinable price or on a fixed or determinable date or dates, is redeemable at the option of the holder, or has conditions for redemption which are not solely within the control of the issuer. Includes stock with a put option held by an ESOP and stock redeemable by a holder only in the event of a change in control of the issuer.

Concept.name: TemporaryEquityCarryingAmountIncludingPortionAttributableToNoncontrollingInterests
Concept.label: Temporary Equity, Carrying Amount, Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interests
Concept.description: Carrying amount, attributable to parent and noncontrolling interests, of an entity's issued and outstanding stock which is not included within permanent equity. Temporary equity is a security with redemption features that are outside the control of the issuer, is not classified as an asset or liability in conformity with GAAP, and is not mandatorily redeemable. Includes any type of security that is redeemable at a fixed or determinable price or on a fixed or determinable date or dates, is redeemable at the option of the holder, or has conditions for redemption which are not solely within the control of the issuer. Includes stock with a put option held by an ESOP and stock redeemable by a holder only in the event of a change in control of the issuer.

Children.Label: Statement of Financial Position, Unclassified - Deposit Based Operations (44)

Concept.name: Assets
Concept.label: Assets
Concept.description: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all assets that are recognized. Assets are probable future economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past transactions or events.

Children.Label: [G]Cash, Cash Equivalents, and Federal Funds Sold

Concept.name: CashAndCashEquivalentsAtCarryingValue
Concept.label: Cash and Cash Equivalents, at Carrying Value
Concept.description: Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Excludes cash and cash equivalents within disposal group and discontinued operation.

Concept.name: CryptoAssetFairValue
Concept.label: Crypto Asset Fair Value
Concept.description: <nil>

Concept.name: AvailableForSaleSecuritiesDebtSecurities
Concept.label: Debt Securities, Available-for-sale
Concept.description: Amount of investment in debt security measured at fair value with change in fair value recognized in other comprehensive income (available-for-sale).

Concept.name: DeferredIncomeTaxAssetsNet
Concept.label: Deferred Income Tax Assets, Net
Concept.description: Amount, after allocation of valuation allowances and deferred tax liability, of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible differences and carryforwards, with jurisdictional netting.

Concept.name: FinanceLeaseRightOfUseAsset
Concept.label: Finance Lease, Right-of-Use Asset, after Accumulated Amortization
Concept.description: Amount, after accumulated amortization, of right-of-use asset from finance lease.

Concept.name: Goodwill
Concept.label: Goodwill
Concept.description: Amount after accumulated impairment loss of an asset representing future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognized.

Concept.name: FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsAccumulatedAmortization
Concept.label: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Accumulated Amortization
Concept.description: Accumulated amount of amortization of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life.

Concept.name: FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsGross
Concept.label: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Gross
Concept.description: Amount before amortization of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life.

Concept.name: FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsNet
Concept.label: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Net
Concept.description: Amount after amortization of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life.

Concept.name: IndefiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsExcludingGoodwill
Concept.label: Indefinite-lived Intangible Assets (Excluding Goodwill)
Concept.description: Amount of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance and having a projected indefinite period of benefit.

Concept.name: IntangibleAssetsNetExcludingGoodwill
Concept.label: Intangible Assets, Net (Excluding Goodwill)
Concept.description: Sum of the carrying amounts of all intangible assets, excluding goodwill, as of the balance sheet date, net of accumulated amortization and impairment charges.

Concept.name: MarketableSecurities
Concept.label: Marketable Securities
Concept.description: Amount of investment in marketable security.

Children.Label: [G]Financing Receivable, after Allowance for Credit Loss

Concept.name: FinancingReceivableAllowanceForCreditLosses
Concept.label: Financing Receivable, Allowance for Credit Loss
Concept.description: Amount of allowance for credit loss on financing receivable. Excludes allowance for financing receivable covered under loss sharing agreement.

Concept.name: NotesReceivableNet
Concept.label: Financing Receivable, after Allowance for Credit Loss
Concept.description: Amount, after allowance for credit loss, of financing receivable. Excludes financing receivable covered under loss sharing agreement.

Concept.name: OperatingLeaseRightOfUseAsset
Concept.label: Operating Lease, Right-of-Use Asset
Concept.description: Amount of lessee's right to use underlying asset under operating lease.

Concept.name: AccumulatedDepreciationDepletionAndAmortizationPropertyPlantAndEquipment
Concept.label: Accumulated Depreciation, Depletion and Amortization, Property, Plant, and Equipment
Concept.description: Amount of accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization for physical assets used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services.

Concept.name: PropertyPlantAndEquipmentGross
Concept.label: Property, Plant and Equipment, Gross
Concept.description: Amount before accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization of physical assets used in the normal conduct of business and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, and furniture and fixtures.

Concept.name: PropertyPlantAndEquipmentNet
Concept.label: Property, Plant and Equipment, Net
Concept.description: Amount after accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization of physical assets used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, and furniture and fixtures.

Concept.name: RestrictedCashAndCashEquivalents
Concept.label: Restricted Cash and Cash Equivalents
Concept.description: Amount of cash and cash equivalents restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Concept.name: InterestPayableCurrentAndNoncurrent
Concept.label: Interest Payable
Concept.description: Amount of interest payable on debt, including, but not limited to, trade payables.

Concept.name: UnrecognizedTaxBenefitsIncomeTaxPenaltiesAndInterestAccrued
Concept.label: Unrecognized Tax Benefits, Income Tax Penalties and Interest Accrued
Concept.description: Amount accrued for interest on an underpayment of income taxes and penalties related to a tax position claimed or expected to be claimed in the tax return.

Concept.name: ContractWithCustomerLiability
Concept.label: Contract with Customer, Liability
Concept.description: Amount of obligation to transfer good or service to customer for which consideration has been received or is receivable.

Concept.name: FinanceLeaseLiability
Concept.label: Finance Lease, Liability
Concept.description: Present value of lessee's discounted obligation for lease payments from finance lease.

Concept.name: LineOfCredit
Concept.label: Long-term Line of Credit
Concept.description: The carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the current and noncurrent portions of long-term obligations drawn from a line of credit, which is a bank's commitment to make loans up to a specific amount. Examples of items that might be included in the application of this element may consist of letters of credit, standby letters of credit, and revolving credit arrangements, under which borrowings can be made up to a maximum amount as of any point in time conditional on satisfaction of specified terms before, as of and after the date of drawdowns on the line. Includes short-term obligations that would normally be classified as current liabilities but for which (a) postbalance sheet date issuance of a long term obligation to refinance the short term obligation on a long term basis, or (b) the enterprise has entered into a financing agreement that clearly permits the enterprise to refinance the short-term obligation on a long term basis and the following conditions are met (1) the agreement does not expire within 1 year and is not cancelable by the lender except for violation of an objectively determinable provision, (2) no violation exists at the BS date, and (3) the lender has entered into the financing agreement is expected to be financially capable of honoring the agreement.

Concept.name: LongTermDebt
Concept.label: Long-term Debt
Concept.description: Amount, after unamortized (discount) premium and debt issuance costs, of long-term debt. Includes, but not limited to, notes payable, bonds payable, debentures, mortgage loans and commercial paper. Excludes capital lease obligations.

Concept.name: WarehouseAgreementBorrowings
Concept.label: Warehouse Agreement Borrowings
Concept.description: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the outstanding short-term borrowings under a revolving line of credit used by mortgage bankers to finance the origination or purchase of loans.

Concept.name: Liabilities
Concept.label: Liabilities
Concept.description: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all liabilities that are recognized. Liabilities are probable future sacrifices of economic benefits arising from present obligations of an entity to transfer assets or provide services to other entities in the future.

Concept.name: OperatingLeaseLiability
Concept.label: Operating Lease, Liability
Concept.description: Present value of lessee's discounted obligation for lease payments from operating lease.

Concept.name: LiabilitiesAndStockholdersEquity
Concept.label: Liabilities and Equity
Concept.description: Amount of liabilities and equity items, including the portion of equity attributable to noncontrolling interests, if any.

Children.Label: [G]Equity, Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest

Concept.name: MinorityInterest
Concept.label: Stockholders' Equity Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest
Concept.description: Total of all stockholders' equity (deficit) items, net of receivables from officers, directors, owners, and affiliates of the entity which is directly or indirectly attributable to that ownership interest in subsidiary equity which is not attributable to the parent (that is, noncontrolling interest, previously referred to as minority interest).

Children.Label: [G]Accumulated Other Comprehensive Income (Loss), Net of Tax

Concept.name: AccumulatedOtherComprehensiveIncomeLossNetOfTax
Concept.label: Accumulated Other Comprehensive Income (Loss), Net of Tax
Concept.description: Accumulated change in equity from transactions and other events and circumstances from non-owner sources, net of tax effect, at period end. Excludes Net Income (Loss), and accumulated changes in equity from transactions resulting from investments by owners and distributions to owners. Includes foreign currency translation items, certain pension adjustments, unrealized gains and losses on certain investments in debt and equity securities, other than temporary impairment (OTTI) losses related to factors other than credit losses on available-for-sale and held-to-maturity debt securities that an entity does not intend to sell and it is not more likely than not that the entity will be required to sell before recovery of the amortized cost basis, as well as changes in the fair value of derivatives related to the effective portion of a designated cash flow hedge.

Concept.name: AdditionalPaidInCapital
Concept.label: Additional Paid in Capital
Concept.description: Excess of issue price over par or stated value of the entity's capital stock and amounts received from other transactions involving the entity's stock or stockholders. Includes adjustments to additional paid in capital. Some examples of such adjustments include recording the issuance of debt with a beneficial conversion feature and certain tax consequences of equity instruments awarded to employees. Use this element for the aggregate amount of additional paid-in capital associated with common and preferred stock. For additional paid-in capital associated with only common stock, use the element additional paid in capital, common stock. For additional paid-in capital associated with only preferred stock, use the element additional paid in capital, preferred stock.

Concept.name: AdditionalPaidInCapitalCommonStock
Concept.label: Additional Paid in Capital, Common Stock
Concept.description: Value received from shareholders in common stock-related transactions that are in excess of par value or stated value and amounts received from other stock-related transactions. Includes only common stock transactions (excludes preferred stock transactions). May be called contributed capital, capital in excess of par, capital surplus, or paid-in capital.

Concept.name: CommonStockValue
Concept.label: Common Stock, Value, Issued
Concept.description: Aggregate par or stated value of issued nonredeemable common stock (or common stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer). This item includes treasury stock repurchased by the entity. Note: elements for number of nonredeemable common shares, par value and other disclosure concepts are in another section within stockholders' equity.

Concept.name: PreferredStockValue
Concept.label: Preferred Stock, Value, Issued
Concept.description: Aggregate par or stated value of issued nonredeemable preferred stock (or preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer). This item includes treasury stock repurchased by the entity. Note: elements for number of nonredeemable preferred shares, par value and other disclosure concepts are in another section within stockholders' equity.

Concept.name: RetainedEarningsAccumulatedDeficit
Concept.label: Retained Earnings (Accumulated Deficit)
Concept.description: The cumulative amount of the reporting entity's undistributed earnings or deficit.

Concept.name: StockholdersEquity
Concept.label: Stockholders' Equity Attributable to Parent
Concept.description: Total of all stockholders' equity (deficit) items, net of receivables from officers, directors, owners, and affiliates of the entity which are attributable to the parent. The amount of the economic entity's stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the amount of stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in subsidiary equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling interest, minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes called permanent equity.

Concept.name: StockholdersEquityIncludingPortionAttributableToNoncontrollingInterest
Concept.label: Stockholders' Equity, Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest
Concept.description: Amount of stockholders' equity (deficit), net of receivables from officers, directors, owners, and affiliates of the entity, attributable to both the parent and noncontrolling interests. Amount excludes temporary equity. Alternate caption for the concept is permanent equity.

Children.Label: [G]Temporary Equity, Carrying Amount, Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interests

Concept.name: RedeemableNoncontrollingInterestEquityCarryingAmount
Concept.label: Redeemable Noncontrolling Interest, Equity, Carrying Amount
Concept.description: As of the reporting date, the aggregate carrying amount of all noncontrolling interests which are redeemable by the (parent) entity (1) at a fixed or determinable price on a fixed or determinable date, (2) at the option of the holder of the noncontrolling interest, or (3) upon occurrence of an event that is not solely within the control of the (parent) entity. This item includes noncontrolling interest holder's ownership (or holders' ownership) regardless of the type of equity interest (common, preferred, other) including all potential organizational (legal) forms of the investee entity.

Concept.name: TemporaryEquityCarryingAmountAttributableToParent
Concept.label: Temporary Equity, Carrying Amount, Attributable to Parent
Concept.description: Carrying amount, attributable to parent, of an entity's issued and outstanding stock which is not included within permanent equity. Temporary equity is a security with redemption features that are outside the control of the issuer, is not classified as an asset or liability in conformity with GAAP, and is not mandatorily redeemable. Includes any type of security that is redeemable at a fixed or determinable price or on a fixed or determinable date or dates, is redeemable at the option of the holder, or has conditions for redemption which are not solely within the control of the issuer. Includes stock with a put option held by an ESOP and stock redeemable by a holder only in the event of a change in control of the issuer.

Concept.name: TemporaryEquityCarryingAmountIncludingPortionAttributableToNoncontrollingInterests
Concept.label: Temporary Equity, Carrying Amount, Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interests
Concept.description: Carrying amount, attributable to parent and noncontrolling interests, of an entity's issued and outstanding stock which is not included within permanent equity. Temporary equity is a security with redemption features that are outside the control of the issuer, is not classified as an asset or liability in conformity with GAAP, and is not mandatorily redeemable. Includes any type of security that is redeemable at a fixed or determinable price or on a fixed or determinable date or dates, is redeemable at the option of the holder, or has conditions for redemption which are not solely within the control of the issuer. Includes stock with a put option held by an ESOP and stock redeemable by a holder only in the event of a change in control of the issuer.

Children.Label: Stockholders Equity Number Of Shares Par Value And Other Disclosures
Common Stock Number Of Shares Par Value And Other Disclosures

Concept.name: CommonStockValue
Concept.label: Common Stock, Value, Issued
Concept.description: Aggregate par or stated value of issued nonredeemable common stock (or common stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer). This item includes treasury stock repurchased by the entity. Note: elements for number of nonredeemable common shares, par value and other disclosure concepts are in another section within stockholders' equity.

Children.Label: Preferred Stock Number Of Shares Par Value And Other Disclosures

Concept.name: PreferredStockValue
Concept.label: Preferred Stock, Value, Issued
Concept.description: Aggregate par or stated value of issued nonredeemable preferred stock (or preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer). This item includes treasury stock repurchased by the entity. Note: elements for number of nonredeemable preferred shares, par value and other disclosure concepts are in another section within stockholders' equity.

Children.Label: Statement of Financial Position, Unclassified - Insurance Based Operations (42)

Concept.name: Assets
Concept.label: Assets
Concept.description: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all assets that are recognized. Assets are probable future economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past transactions or events.

Concept.name: CryptoAssetFairValue
Concept.label: Crypto Asset Fair Value
Concept.description: <nil>

Concept.label: Deferred Income Tax Assets, Net
Concept.description: Amount, after allocation of valuation allowances and deferred tax liability, of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible differences and carryforwards, with jurisdictional netting.

Concept.name: Goodwill
Concept.label: Goodwill
Concept.description: Amount after accumulated impairment loss of an asset representing future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognized.

Concept.name: FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsAccumulatedAmortization
Concept.label: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Accumulated Amortization
Concept.description: Accumulated amount of amortization of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life.

Concept.name: FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsGross
Concept.label: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Gross
Concept.description: Amount before amortization of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life.

Concept.name: FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsNet
Concept.label: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets, Net
Concept.description: Amount after amortization of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life.

Concept.name: IndefiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsExcludingGoodwill
Concept.label: Indefinite-lived Intangible Assets (Excluding Goodwill)
Concept.description: Amount of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance and having a projected indefinite period of benefit.

Concept.name: IntangibleAssetsNetExcludingGoodwill
Concept.label: Intangible Assets, Net (Excluding Goodwill)
Concept.description: Sum of the carrying amounts of all intangible assets, excluding goodwill, as of the balance sheet date, net of accumulated amortization and impairment charges.

Concept.name: CashAndCashEquivalentsAtCarryingValue
Concept.label: Cash and Cash Equivalents, at Carrying Value
Concept.description: Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Excludes cash and cash equivalents within disposal group and discontinued operation.

Concept.name: AvailableForSaleSecuritiesDebtSecurities
Concept.label: Debt Securities, Available-for-sale
Concept.description: Amount of investment in debt security measured at fair value with change in fair value recognized in other comprehensive income (available-for-sale).

Concept.name: MarketableSecurities
Concept.label: Marketable Securities
Concept.description: Amount of investment in marketable security.

Children.Label: [G]Financing Receivable, after Allowance for Credit Loss

Concept.name: FinancingReceivableAllowanceForCreditLosses
Concept.label: Financing Receivable, Allowance for Credit Loss
Concept.description: Amount of allowance for credit loss on financing receivable. Excludes allowance for financing receivable covered under loss sharing agreement.

Concept.name: NotesReceivableNet
Concept.label: Financing Receivable, after Allowance for Credit Loss
Concept.description: Amount, after allowance for credit loss, of financing receivable. Excludes financing receivable covered under loss sharing agreement.

Concept.name: AccumulatedDepreciationDepletionAndAmortizationPropertyPlantAndEquipment
Concept.label: Accumulated Depreciation, Depletion and Amortization, Property, Plant, and Equipment
Concept.description: Amount of accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization for physical assets used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services.

Concept.name: PropertyPlantAndEquipmentGross
Concept.label: Property, Plant and Equipment, Gross
Concept.description: Amount before accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization of physical assets used in the normal conduct of business and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, and furniture and fixtures.

Concept.name: PropertyPlantAndEquipmentNet
Concept.label: Property, Plant and Equipment, Net
Concept.description: Amount after accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization of physical assets used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, and furniture and fixtures.

Concept.name: RestrictedCashAndCashEquivalents
Concept.label: Restricted Cash and Cash Equivalents
Concept.description: Amount of cash and cash equivalents restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Concept.name: LiabilitiesAndStockholdersEquity

Concept.description: Amount of liabilities and equity items, including the portion of equity attributable to noncontrolling interests, if any.

Children.Label: Limited Liability Company LLC Members Equity Including Portion Attributable To Noncontrolling Interest
Limited Liability Company LLC Members Equity

Concept.name: AccumulatedOtherComprehensiveIncomeLossNetOfTax
Concept.label: Accumulated Other Comprehensive Income (Loss), Net of Tax
Concept.description: Accumulated change in equity from transactions and other events and circumstances from non-owner sources, net of tax effect, at period end.
