Concept.description: The aggregate expense charged against earnings to allocate the cost of intangible assets (nonphysical assets not used in production) in a systematic and rational manner to the periods expected to benefit from such assets. As a noncash expense, this element is added back to net income when calculating cash provided by or used in operations using the indirect method.

Concept.name: ShareBasedCompensation
Concept.label: Share-based Payment Arrangement, Noncash Expense
Concept.description: Amount of noncash expense for share-based payment arrangement.

Concept.name: FairValueAdjustmentOfWarrants
Concept.label: Fair Value Adjustment of Warrants
Concept.description: Amount of expense (income) related to adjustment to fair value of warrant liability.

Concept.name: ForeignCurrencyTransactionGainLossBeforeTax
Concept.label: Foreign Currency Transaction Gain (Loss), before Tax
Concept.description: Amount before tax of foreign currency transaction realized and unrealized gain (loss) recognized in the income statement.

Children.Label: [G]Gain (Loss) on Disposition of Property Plant Equipment, Excluding Oil and Gas Property and Timber Property

Concept.name: GainLossOnDispositionOfAssets1
Concept.label: Gain (Loss) on Disposition of Assets
Concept.description: Amount of gain (loss) on sale or disposal of assets, including but not limited to property plant and equipment, intangible assets and equity in securities of subsidiaries or equity method investee.

Concept.name: GainLossOnDispositionOfIntangibleAssets
Concept.label: Gain (Loss) on Disposition of Intangible Assets
Concept.description: Amount of gain (loss) on sale or disposal of intangible assets.

Children.Label: [G]Gain (Loss) on Disposition of Property Plant Equipment

Concept.name: GainLossOnSaleOfPropertyPlantEquipment
Concept.label: Gain (Loss) on Disposition of Property Plant Equipment
Concept.description: Amount of gain (loss) on sale or disposal of property, plant and equipment assets, including oil and gas property and timber property.

Concept.name: GainsLossesOnExtinguishmentOfDebt
Concept.label: Gain (Loss) on Extinguishment of Debt
Concept.description: Difference between the fair value of payments made and the carrying amount of debt which is extinguished prior to maturity.

Concept.name: OtherNoncashIncomeExpense
Concept.label: Other Noncash Income (Expense)
Concept.description: Amount of income (expense) included in net income that results in no cash inflow (outflow), classified as other.

Concept.name: GoodwillImpairmentLoss
Concept.label: Goodwill, Impairment Loss
Concept.description: Amount of loss from the write-down of an asset representing the future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognized.

Concept.name: ImpairmentOfIntangibleAssetsIndefinitelivedExcludingGoodwill
Concept.label: Impairment of Intangible Assets, Indefinite-lived (Excluding Goodwill)
Concept.description: Amount of impairment loss resulting from write-down of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance and having a projected indefinite period of benefit to fair value.

Concept.name: PaymentsForRestructuring
Concept.label: Payments for Restructuring
Concept.description: Amount of cash payments made as the result of exit or disposal activities. Excludes payments associated with a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.

Concept.name: BusinessExitCosts1
Concept.label: Business Exit Costs
Concept.description: Amount of expenses associated with exit or disposal activities pursuant to an authorized plan. Includes, but is not limited to, one-time termination benefits, termination of an operating lease or other contract, consolidating or closing facilities, and relocating employees, and termination benefits associated with an ongoing benefit arrangement. Excludes expenses associated with special or contractual termination benefits, a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.

Concept.name: SeveranceCosts1
Concept.label: Severance Costs
Concept.description: Amount of expenses for special or contractual termination benefits provided to current employees involuntarily terminated under a benefit arrangement associated exit or disposal activities pursuant to an authorized plan. Excludes expenses related to one-time termination benefits, a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.

Concept.name: RestructuringCosts
Concept.label: Restructuring Costs
Concept.description: Amount, after cash payment, of expenses associated with exit or disposal activities pursuant to an authorized plan. Excludes expenses related to a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.

Concept.name: UnrealizedGainLossOnInvestments
Concept.label: Unrealized Gain (Loss) on Investments
Concept.description: Amount of unrealized gain (loss) on investment.

Children.Label: [G]Adjustment to Reconcile Net Income to Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activity, Increase (Decrease) in Operating Capital

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInOtherOperatingAssets
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Other Operating Assets
Concept.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in operating assets classified as other.

Children.Label: [G]Increase (Decrease) in Prepaid Expense and Other Assets

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInPrepaidDeferredExpenseAndOtherAssets
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Prepaid Expense and Other Assets
Concept.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in prepaid expenses, and assets classified as other.

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInAccountsReceivable
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Accounts Receivable
Concept.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in amount due within one year (or one business cycle) from customers for the credit sale of goods and services.

Children.Label: [G]Increase (Decrease) in Accounts Payable and Accrued Liabilities

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInAccountsPayable
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Accounts Payable
Concept.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the aggregate amount of liabilities incurred (and for which invoices have typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received that are used in an entity's business.

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInAccountsPayableAndAccruedLiabilities
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Accounts Payable and Accrued Liabilities
Concept.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the amounts payable to vendors for goods and services received and the amount of obligations and expenses incurred but not paid.

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInAccruedLiabilities
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Accrued Liabilities
Concept.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the aggregate amount of expenses incurred but not yet paid.

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInDeferredRevenue
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Deferred Revenue
Concept.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in deferred income and obligation to transfer product and service to customer for which consideration has been received or is receivable.

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivitiesContinuingOperations
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activities, Continuing Operations
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from operating activities, excluding discontinued operations. Operating activity cash flows include transactions, adjustments, and changes in value not defined as investing or financing activities.

Concept.name: ProfitLoss
Concept.label: Net Income (Loss), Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest
Concept.description: The consolidated profit or loss for the period, net of income taxes, including the portion attributable to the noncontrolling interest.

Concept.name: CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseIncludingExchangeRateEffect
Concept.label: Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents, Period Increase (Decrease), Including Exchange Rate Effect
Concept.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in cash, cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage; including effect from exchange rate change. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Children.Label: [G]Effect of Exchange Rate on Cash, Cash Equivalent, Restricted Cash, and Restricted Cash Equivalent, Including Discontinued Operation

Concept.name: EffectOfExchangeRateOnCashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalents
Concept.label: Effect of Exchange Rate on Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents
Concept.description: Amount of increase (decrease) from effect of exchange rate changes on cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage; held in foreign currencies. Excludes amounts for disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Concept.name: EffectOfExchangeRateOnCashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsIncludingDisposalGroupAndDiscontinuedOperations
Concept.label: Effect of Exchange Rate on Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents, Including Disposal Group and Discontinued Operations
Concept.description: Amount of increase (decrease) from effect of exchange rate changes on cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage; held in foreign currencies; including, but not limited to, disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Children.Label: Statement of Cash Flows, Insurance Based Operations (80)

Concept.name: CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalents
Concept.label: Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents
Concept.description: Amount of cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage. Excludes amount for disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Concept.name: CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsIncludingDisposalGroupAndDiscontinuedOperations
Concept.label: Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents, Including Disposal Group and Discontinued Operations
Concept.description: Amount of cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage; including, but not limited to, disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Children.Label: [G]Cash, Cash Equivalent, Restricted Cash, and Restricted Cash Equivalent, Including Discontinued Operation

Concept.name: CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalents
Concept.label: Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents
Concept.description: Amount of cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage. Excludes amount for disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Concept.name: CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsIncludingDisposalGroupAndDiscontinuedOperations
Concept.label: Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents, Including Disposal Group and Discontinued Operations
Concept.description: Amount of cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage; including, but not limited to, disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Children.Label: [G]Cash, Cash Equivalent, Restricted Cash, and Restricted Cash Equivalent, Period Increase (Decrease), Including Exchange Rate Effect and Discontinued Operation
[G]Cash, Cash Equivalent, Restricted Cash, and Restricted Cash Equivalent, Period Increase (Decrease), Excluding Exchange Rate Effect, Including Discontinued Operation
Net Cash Provided By Used In Discontinued Operations And Continuing Operations

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInContinuingOperations
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Continuing Operations
Concept.description: The increase (decrease) in cash associated with the entity's continuing operating, investing, and financing activities. While for technical reasons this element has no balance attribute, the default assumption is a debit balance consistent with its label.

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInFinancingActivitiesContinuingOperations
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Financing Activities, Continuing Operations
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) of financing activities, excluding discontinued operations. Financing activity cash flows include obtaining resources from owners and providing them with a return on, and a return of, their investment; borrowing money and repaying amounts borrowed, or settling the obligation; and obtaining and paying for other resources obtained from creditors on long-term credit.

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInInvestingActivitiesContinuingOperations
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Investing Activities, Continuing Operations
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) of investing activities, excluding discontinued operations. Investing activity cash flows include making and collecting loans and acquiring and disposing of debt or equity instruments and property, plant, and equipment and other productive assets.

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivitiesContinuingOperations
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activities, Continuing Operations
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from operating activities, excluding discontinued operations. Operating activity cash flows include transactions, adjustments, and changes in value not defined as investing or financing activities.

Children.Label: [G]Cash Provided by (Used in) Financing Activity, Including Discontinued Operation

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInFinancingActivities
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Financing Activities
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from financing activities, including discontinued operations. Financing activity cash flows include obtaining resources from owners and providing them with a return on, and a return of, their investment; borrowing money and repaying amounts borrowed, or settling the obligation; and obtaining and paying for other resources obtained from creditors on long-term credit.

Children.Label: [G]Cash Provided by (Used in) Financing Activity, Continuing Operation

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInFinancingActivitiesContinuingOperations
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Financing Activities, Continuing Operations
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) of financing activities, excluding discontinued operations. Financing activity cash flows include obtaining resources from owners and providing them with a return on, and a return of, their investment; borrowing money and repaying amounts borrowed, or settling the obligation; and obtaining and paying for other resources obtained from creditors on long-term credit.

Concept.name: PaymentOfFinancingAndStockIssuanceCosts
Concept.label: Payment of Financing and Stock Issuance Costs
Concept.description: The total of the cash outflow during the period which has been paid to third parties in connection with debt origination, which will be amortized over the remaining maturity period of the associated long-term debt and the cost incurred directly for the issuance of equity securities.

Children.Label: Payments For Proceeds From Hedge Financing Activities

Concept.name: PaymentsForHedgeFinancingActivities
Concept.label: Payments for Hedge, Financing Activities
Concept.description: The cash outflow for a financial contract that meets the hedge criteria as either cash flow hedge, fair value hedge or hedge of net investment in foreign operations.

Concept.name: PaymentsForProceedsFromHedgeFinancingActivities
Concept.label: Payments for (Proceeds from) Hedge, Financing Activities
Concept.description: The net cash outflow or inflow for a financial contract that meets the hedge criteria as either cash flow hedge, fair value hedge or hedge of net investment in foreign operations.

Concept.name: ProceedsFromHedgeFinancingActivities
Concept.label: Proceeds from Hedge, Financing Activities
Concept.description: The cash inflow from a financial contract that meets the hedge criteria as either cash flow hedge, fair value hedge or hedge of net investment in foreign operations.

Concept.name: PaymentsOfDebtIssuanceCosts
Concept.label: Payments of Debt Issuance Costs
Concept.description: The cash outflow paid to third parties in connection with debt origination, which will be amortized over the remaining maturity period of the associated long-term debt.

Concept.name: PaymentsOfFinancingCosts
Concept.label: Payments of Financing Costs
Concept.description: The cash outflow for loan and debt issuance costs.

Concept.name: PaymentsOfStockIssuanceCosts
Concept.label: Payments of Stock Issuance Costs
Concept.description: The cash outflow for cost incurred directly with the issuance of an equity security.

Children.Label: Proceeds From Payments To Minority Shareholders

Concept.name: PaymentsToMinorityShareholders
Concept.label: Payments to Noncontrolling Interests
Concept.description: Amount of cash outflow to a noncontrolling interest. Includes, but not limited to, reduction of noncontrolling interest ownership. Excludes dividends paid to the noncontrolling interest.

Concept.name: ProceedsFromMinorityShareholders
Concept.label: Proceeds from Noncontrolling Interests
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow from a noncontrolling interest. Includes, but is not limited to, purchase of additional shares or other increase in noncontrolling interest ownership.

Children.Label: [G]Proceeds from (Repayments of) Long-Term Debt and Capital Securities
[G]Proceeds from Issuance of Long-Term Debt and Capital Securities, Net

Concept.name: ProceedsFromConvertibleDebt
Concept.label: Proceeds from Convertible Debt
Concept.description: The cash inflow from the issuance of a long-term debt instrument which can be exchanged for a specified amount of another security, typically the entity's common stock, at the option of the issuer or the holder.

Concept.name: ProceedsFromIssuanceOfLongTermDebt
Concept.label: Proceeds from Issuance of Long-term Debt
Concept.description: The cash inflow from a debt initially having maturity due after one year or beyond the operating cycle, if longer.

Concept.name: ProceedsFromRepaymentsOfLongTermDebtAndCapitalSecurities
Concept.label: Proceeds from (Repayments of) Long-term Debt and Capital Securities
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from long-term debt, including capital lease obligations and mandatory redeemable capital securities.

Children.Label: [G]Repayment of Long-Term Debt, Long-Term Lease Obligation, and Capital Security

Concept.name: FinanceLeasePrincipalPayments
Concept.label: Finance Lease, Principal Payments
Concept.description: Amount of cash outflow for principal payment on finance lease.

Concept.name: RepaymentsOfConvertibleDebt
Concept.label: Repayments of Convertible Debt
Concept.description: The cash outflow from the repayment of a long-term debt instrument which can be exchanged for a specified amount of another security, typically the entity's common stock, at the option of the issuer or the holder.

Concept.name: RepaymentsOfLongTermDebt
Concept.label: Repayments of Long-term Debt
Concept.description: The cash outflow for debt initially having maturity due after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

Concept.name: RepaymentsOfRelatedPartyDebt
Concept.label: Repayments of Related Party Debt
Concept.description: The cash outflow for the payment of a long-term borrowing made from a related party where one party can exercise control or significant influence over another party; including affiliates, owners or officers and their immediate families, pension trusts, and so forth. Alternate caption: Payments for Advances from Affiliates.

Children.Label: Proceeds From Repayments Of Other Debt

Concept.name: RepaymentsOfOtherDebt
Concept.label: Repayments of Other Debt
Concept.description: Amount of cash outflow for the payment of debt classified as other.

Children.Label: Proceeds From Repayments Of Short Term Debt

Concept.name: ProceedsFromSecuredNotesPayable
Concept.label: Proceeds from Secured Notes Payable
Concept.description: The cash inflow from borrowings supported by a written promise to pay an obligation that is collateralized (backed by pledge, mortgage or other lien in the entity's assets).

Concept.name: PaymentsForRepurchaseOfWarrants
Concept.label: Payments for Repurchase of Warrants
Concept.description: The aggregate amount paid by the entity to reacquire the right to purchase equity shares at a predetermined price, usually issued together with corporate debt.

Children.Label: [G]Proceeds from Issuance or Sale of Equity

Concept.name: ProceedsFromIssuanceInitialPublicOffering
Concept.label: Proceeds from Issuance Initial Public Offering
Concept.description: The cash inflow associated with the amount received from entity's first offering of stock to the public.

Concept.name: ProceedsFromIssuanceOfCommonStock
Concept.label: Proceeds from Issuance of Common Stock
Concept.description: The cash inflow from the additional capital contribution to the entity.

Concept.name: ProceedsFromIssuanceOfPrivatePlacement
Concept.label: Proceeds from Issuance of Private Placement
Concept.description: The cash inflow associated with the amount received from entity's raising of capital via private rather than public placement.

Concept.name: ProceedsFromIssuanceOfWarrants
Concept.label: Proceeds from Issuance of Warrants
Concept.description: The cash inflow from issuance of rights to purchase common shares at predetermined price (usually issued together with corporate debt).

Children.Label: [G]Cash Provided by (Used in) Investing Activity, Including Discontinued Operation

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInInvestingActivities
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Investing Activities
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from investing activities, including discontinued operations. Investing activity cash flows include making and collecting loans and acquiring and disposing of debt or equity instruments and property, plant, and equipment and other productive assets.

Children.Label: [G]Cash Provided by (Used in) Investing Activity, Continuing Operation

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInInvestingActivitiesContinuingOperations
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Investing Activities, Continuing Operations
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) of investing activities, excluding discontinued operations. Investing activity cash flows include making and collecting loans and acquiring and disposing of debt or equity instruments and property, plant, and equipment and other productive assets.

Children.Label: Payments For Proceeds From Businesses And Interest In Affiliates
[G]Payments to Acquire Businesses and Interest in Affiliates
[G]Payments to Acquire Businesses, Net of Cash Acquired

Concept.name: PaymentsToAcquireBusinessesNetOfCashAcquired
Concept.label: Payments to Acquire Businesses, Net of Cash Acquired
Concept.description: The cash outflow associated with the acquisition of a business, net of the cash acquired from the purchase.

Concept.name: PaymentsToAcquireInvestments
Concept.label: Payments to Acquire Investments
Concept.description: The cash outflow associated with the purchase of all investments (debt, security, other) during the period.

Concept.name: PaymentsToAcquireMarketableSecurities
Concept.label: Payments to Acquire Marketable Securities
Concept.description: Amount of cash outflow for purchase of marketable security.

Children.Label: [G]Proceeds from Sale, Maturity and Collection of Investments
[G]Proceeds from Sale and Maturity of Debt Securities, Available-for-Sale

Concept.name: ProceedsFromMaturitiesPrepaymentsAndCallsOfAvailableForSaleSecurities
Concept.label: Proceeds from Maturities, Prepayments and Calls of Debt Securities, Available-for-sale
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow from maturity, prepayment and call of investment in debt security measured at fair value with change in fair value recognized in other comprehensive income (available-for-sale).

Concept.name: ProceedsFromSaleAndMaturityOfMarketableSecurities
Concept.label: Proceeds from Sale and Maturity of Marketable Securities
Concept.description: The cash inflow associated with the aggregate amount received by the entity through sale or maturity of marketable securities (held-to-maturity or available-for-sale) during the period.

Concept.name: ProceedsFromSaleMaturityAndCollectionsOfInvestments
Concept.label: Proceeds from Sale, Maturity and Collection of Investments
Concept.description: The cash inflow associated with the sale, maturity and collection of all investments such as debt, security and so forth during the period.

Children.Label: Payments For Proceeds From Productive Assets

Concept.name: PaymentsToAcquireIntangibleAssets
Concept.label: Payments to Acquire Intangible Assets
Concept.description: The cash outflow to acquire asset without physical form usually arising from contractual or other legal rights, excluding goodwill.

Children.Label: [G]Payments to Acquire Property, Plant, and Equipment

Concept.name: PaymentsToAcquireLandHeldForUse
Concept.label: Payments to Acquire Land Held-for-use
Concept.description: The cash outflow for acquisition of land for use; excludes purchases of land held as inventory or as investments.

Concept.name: PaymentsToAcquirePropertyPlantAndEquipment
Concept.label: Payments to Acquire Property, Plant, and Equipment
Concept.description: The cash outflow associated with the acquisition of long-lived, physical assets that are used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services and not intended for resale; includes cash outflows to pay for construction of self-constructed assets.

Children.Label: [G]Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activity, Including Discontinued Operation

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activities
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from operating activities, including discontinued operations. Operating activity cash flows include transactions, adjustments, and changes in value not defined as investing or financing activities.

Children.Label: [G]Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activity, Continuing Operation
[G]Adjustment to Reconcile Net Income to Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activity
[G]Adjustment to Reconcile Net Income to Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activity, Noncash Item

Concept.name: AdjustmentsNoncashItemsToReconcileNetIncomeLossToCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities
Concept.label: Adjustments, Noncash Items, to Reconcile Net Income (Loss) to Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activities
Concept.description: The aggregate amount of adjustments to net income or loss necessary to remove the effects of all items whose cash effects are investing or financing cash flows. The aggregate amount also includes all noncash expenses and income items which reduce or increase net income and are thus added back or deducted when calculating cash provided by or used in operating activities.

Children.Label: [G]Amortization of Debt Issuance Costs and Discounts

Concept.name: AmortizationOfDebtDiscountPremium
Concept.label: Amortization of Debt Discount (Premium)
Concept.description: Amount of noncash expense included in interest expense to amortize debt discount and premium associated with the related debt instruments. Excludes amortization of financing costs. Alternate captions include noncash interest expense.

Concept.name: AmortizationOfFinancingCosts
Concept.label: Amortization of Debt Issuance Costs
Concept.description: Amount of amortization expense attributable to debt issuance costs.

Concept.name: AmortizationOfFinancingCostsAndDiscounts
Concept.label: Amortization of Debt Issuance Costs and Discounts
Concept.description: Amount of amortization expense attributable to debt discount (premium) and debt issuance costs.

Concept.name: DeferredIncomeTaxExpenseBenefit
Concept.label: Deferred Income Tax Expense (Benefit)
Concept.description: Amount of deferred income tax expense (benefit) pertaining to income (loss) from continuing operations.

Concept.name: InvestmentTaxCredit
Concept.label: Investment Tax Credit
Concept.description: The amount deducted from an entities' taxes, reflecting a percentage of an amount invested in certain assets spread over the useful life of those assets; includes deferred investment tax credits.

Concept.name: AccretionAmortizationOfDiscountsAndPremiumsInvestments
Concept.label: Accretion (Amortization) of Discounts and Premiums, Investments
Concept.description: The sum of the periodic adjustments of the differences between securities' face values and purchase prices that are charged against earnings. This is called accretion if the security was purchased at a discount and amortization if it was purchased at premium. As a noncash item, this element is an adjustment to net income when calculating cash provided by or used in operations using the indirect method.

Concept.name: AmortizationOfIntangibleAssets
Concept.label: Amortization of Intangible Assets
Concept.description: The aggregate expense charged against earnings to allocate the cost of intangible assets (nonphysical assets not used in production) in a systematic and rational manner to the periods expected to benefit from such assets. As a noncash expense, this element is added back to net income when calculating cash provided by or used in operations using the indirect method.

Concept.name: ShareBasedCompensation
Concept.label: Share-based Payment Arrangement, Noncash Expense
Concept.description: Amount of noncash expense for share-based payment arrangement.

Concept.name: FairValueAdjustmentOfWarrants
Concept.label: Fair Value Adjustment of Warrants
Concept.description: Amount of expense (income) related to adjustment to fair value of warrant liability.

Concept.name: ForeignCurrencyTransactionGainLossBeforeTax
Concept.label: Foreign Currency Transaction Gain (Loss), before Tax
Concept.description: Amount before tax of foreign currency transaction realized and unrealized gain (loss) recognized in the income statement.

Children.Label: [G]Gain (Loss) on Disposition of Property Plant Equipment, Excluding Oil and Gas Property and Timber Property

Concept.name: GainLossOnDispositionOfAssets1
Concept.label: Gain (Loss) on Disposition of Assets
Concept.description: Amount of gain (loss) on sale or disposal of assets, including but not limited to property plant and equipment, intangible assets and equity in securities of subsidiaries or equity method investee.

Concept.name: GainLossOnDispositionOfIntangibleAssets
Concept.label: Gain (Loss) on Disposition of Intangible Assets
Concept.description: Amount of gain (loss) on sale or disposal of intangible assets.

Children.Label: [G]Gain (Loss) on Disposition of Property Plant Equipment

Concept.name: GainLossOnSaleOfPropertyPlantEquipment
Concept.label: Gain (Loss) on Disposition of Property Plant Equipment
Concept.description: Amount of gain (loss) on sale or disposal of property, plant and equipment assets, including oil and gas property and timber property.

Concept.name: OtherNoncashIncomeExpense
Concept.label: Other Noncash Income (Expense)
Concept.description: Amount of income (expense) included in net income that results in no cash inflow (outflow), classified as other.

Concept.name: GoodwillImpairmentLoss
Concept.label: Goodwill, Impairment Loss
Concept.description: Amount of loss from the write-down of an asset representing the future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognized.

Concept.name: ImpairmentOfIntangibleAssetsIndefinitelivedExcludingGoodwill
Concept.label: Impairment of Intangible Assets, Indefinite-lived (Excluding Goodwill)
Concept.description: Amount of impairment loss resulting from write-down of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance and having a projected indefinite period of benefit to fair value.

Concept.name: PaymentsForRestructuring
Concept.label: Payments for Restructuring
Concept.description: Amount of cash payments made as the result of exit or disposal activities. Excludes payments associated with a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.

Concept.name: BusinessExitCosts1
Concept.label: Business Exit Costs
Concept.description: Amount of expenses associated with exit or disposal activities pursuant to an authorized plan. Includes, but is not limited to, one-time termination benefits, termination of an operating lease or other contract, consolidating or closing facilities, and relocating employees, and termination benefits associated with an ongoing benefit arrangement. Excludes expenses associated with special or contractual termination benefits, a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.

Concept.name: SeveranceCosts1
Concept.label: Severance Costs
Concept.description: Amount of expenses for special or contractual termination benefits provided to current employees involuntarily terminated under a benefit arrangement associated exit or disposal activities pursuant to an authorized plan. Excludes expenses related to one-time termination benefits, a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.

Concept.name: RestructuringCosts
Concept.label: Restructuring Costs
Concept.description: Amount, after cash payment, of expenses associated with exit or disposal activities pursuant to an authorized plan. Excludes expenses related to a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.

Concept.name: UnrealizedGainLossOnInvestments
Concept.label: Unrealized Gain (Loss) on Investments
Concept.description: Amount of unrealized gain (loss) on investment.

Children.Label: [G]Adjustment to Reconcile Net Income to Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activity, Increase (Decrease) in Operating Capital

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInOtherOperatingAssets
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Other Operating Assets
Concept.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in operating assets classified as other.

Children.Label: [G]Increase (Decrease) in Prepaid Expense and Other Assets

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInPrepaidDeferredExpenseAndOtherAssets
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Prepaid Expense and Other Assets
Concept.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in prepaid expenses, and assets classified as other.

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInAccountsReceivable
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Accounts Receivable
Concept.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in amount due within one year (or one business cycle) from customers for the credit sale of goods and services.

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInNotesReceivables
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Notes Receivables
Concept.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period of the amounts due from borrowers for outstanding secured or unsecured loans evidenced by a note.

Children.Label: [G]Increase (Decrease) in Accounts Payable and Accrued Liabilities

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInAccountsPayable
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Accounts Payable
Concept.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the aggregate amount of liabilities incurred (and for which invoices have typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received that are used in an entity's business.

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInAccountsPayableAndAccruedLiabilities
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Accounts Payable and Accrued Liabilities
Concept.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the amounts payable to vendors for goods and services received and the amount of obligations and expenses incurred but not paid.

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInAccruedLiabilities
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Accrued Liabilities
Concept.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the aggregate amount of expenses incurred but not yet paid.

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInDeferredRevenue
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Deferred Revenue
Concept.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in deferred income and obligation to transfer product and service to customer for which consideration has been received or is receivable.

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivitiesContinuingOperations
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activities, Continuing Operations
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from operating activities, excluding discontinued operations. Operating activity cash flows include transactions, adjustments, and changes in value not defined as investing or financing activities.

Concept.name: ProfitLoss
Concept.label: Net Income (Loss), Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest
Concept.description: The consolidated profit or loss for the period, net of income taxes, including the portion attributable to the noncontrolling interest.

Concept.name: CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseIncludingExchangeRateEffect
Concept.label: Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents, Period Increase (Decrease), Including Exchange Rate Effect
Concept.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in cash, cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage; including effect from exchange rate change. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Children.Label: [G]Effect of Exchange Rate on Cash, Cash Equivalent, Restricted Cash, and Restricted Cash Equivalent, Including Discontinued Operation

Concept.name: EffectOfExchangeRateOnCashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalents
Concept.label: Effect of Exchange Rate on Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents
Concept.description: Amount of increase (decrease) from effect of exchange rate changes on cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage; held in foreign currencies. Excludes amounts for disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Concept.name: EffectOfExchangeRateOnCashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsIncludingDisposalGroupAndDiscontinuedOperations
Concept.label: Effect of Exchange Rate on Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents, Including Disposal Group and Discontinued Operations
Concept.description: Amount of increase (decrease) from effect of exchange rate changes on cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage; held in foreign currencies; including, but not limited to, disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Children.Label: Statement of Cash Flows, Securities Based Operations (78)

Concept.name: CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalents
Concept.label: Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents
Concept.description: Amount of cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage. Excludes amount for disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Concept.name: CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsIncludingDisposalGroupAndDiscontinuedOperations
Concept.label: Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents, Including Disposal Group and Discontinued Operations
Concept.description: Amount of cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage; including, but not limited to, disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Children.Label: [G]Cash, Cash Equivalent, Restricted Cash, and Restricted Cash Equivalent, Including Discontinued Operation

Concept.name: CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalents
Concept.label: Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents
Concept.description: Amount of cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage. Excludes amount for disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Concept.name: CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsIncludingDisposalGroupAndDiscontinuedOperations
Concept.label: Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents, Including Disposal Group and Discontinued Operations
Concept.description: Amount of cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage; including, but not limited to, disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Children.Label: [G]Cash, Cash Equivalent, Restricted Cash, and Restricted Cash Equivalent, Period Increase (Decrease), Including Exchange Rate Effect and Discontinued Operation
[G]Cash, Cash Equivalent, Restricted Cash, and Restricted Cash Equivalent, Period Increase (Decrease), Excluding Exchange Rate Effect, Including Discontinued Operation
Net Cash Provided By Used In Discontinued Operations And Continuing Operations

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInContinuingOperations
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Continuing Operations
Concept.description: The increase (decrease) in cash associated with the entity's continuing operating, investing, and financing activities. While for technical reasons this element has no balance attribute, the default assumption is a debit balance consistent with its label.

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInFinancingActivitiesContinuingOperations
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Financing Activities, Continuing Operations
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) of financing activities, excluding discontinued operations. Financing activity cash flows include obtaining resources from owners and providing them with a return on, and a return of, their investment; borrowing money and repaying amounts borrowed, or settling the obligation; and obtaining and paying for other resources obtained from creditors on long-term credit.

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInInvestingActivitiesContinuingOperations
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Investing Activities, Continuing Operations
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) of investing activities, excluding discontinued operations. Investing activity cash flows include making and collecting loans and acquiring and disposing of debt or equity instruments and property, plant, and equipment and other productive assets.

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivitiesContinuingOperations
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activities, Continuing Operations
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from operating activities, excluding discontinued operations. Operating activity cash flows include transactions, adjustments, and changes in value not defined as investing or financing activities.

Children.Label: [G]Cash Provided by (Used in) Financing Activity, Including Discontinued Operation

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInFinancingActivities
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Financing Activities
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from financing activities, including discontinued operations. Financing activity cash flows include obtaining resources from owners and providing them with a return on, and a return of, their investment; borrowing money and repaying amounts borrowed, or settling the obligation; and obtaining and paying for other resources obtained from creditors on long-term credit.

Children.Label: [G]Cash Provided by (Used in) Financing Activity, Continuing Operation

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInFinancingActivitiesContinuingOperations
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Financing Activities, Continuing Operations
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) of financing activities, excluding discontinued operations. Financing activity cash flows include obtaining resources from owners and providing them with a return on, and a return of, their investment; borrowing money and repaying amounts borrowed, or settling the obligation; and obtaining and paying for other resources obtained from creditors on long-term credit.

Concept.name: PaymentOfFinancingAndStockIssuanceCosts
Concept.label: Payment of Financing and Stock Issuance Costs
Concept.description: The total of the cash outflow during the period which has been paid to third parties in connection with debt origination, which will be amortized over the remaining maturity period of the associated long-term debt and the cost incurred directly for the issuance of equity securities.

Children.Label: Payments For Proceeds From Hedge Financing Activities

Concept.name: PaymentsForHedgeFinancingActivities
Concept.label: Payments for Hedge, Financing Activities
Concept.description: The cash outflow for a financial contract that meets the hedge criteria as either cash flow hedge, fair value hedge or hedge of net investment in foreign operations.

Concept.name: PaymentsForProceedsFromHedgeFinancingActivities
Concept.label: Payments for (Proceeds from) Hedge, Financing Activities
Concept.description: The net cash outflow or inflow for a financial contract that meets the hedge criteria as either cash flow hedge, fair value hedge or hedge of net investment in foreign operations.

Concept.name: ProceedsFromHedgeFinancingActivities
Concept.label: Proceeds from Hedge, Financing Activities
Concept.description: The cash inflow from a financial contract that meets the hedge criteria as either cash flow hedge, fair value hedge or hedge of net investment in foreign operations.

Concept.name: PaymentsOfDebtIssuanceCosts
Concept.label: Payments of Debt Issuance Costs
Concept.description: The cash outflow paid to third parties in connection with debt origination, which will be amortized over the remaining maturity period of the associated long-term debt.

Concept.name: PaymentsOfFinancingCosts
Concept.label: Payments of Financing Costs
Concept.description: The cash outflow for loan and debt issuance costs.

Concept.name: PaymentsOfStockIssuanceCosts
Concept.label: Payments of Stock Issuance Costs
Concept.description: The cash outflow for cost incurred directly with the issuance of an equity security.

Children.Label: Proceeds From Payments To Minority Shareholders

Concept.name: PaymentsToMinorityShareholders
Concept.label: Payments to Noncontrolling Interests
Concept.description: Amount of cash outflow to a noncontrolling interest. Includes, but not limited to, reduction of noncontrolling interest ownership. Excludes dividends paid to the noncontrolling interest.

Concept.name: ProceedsFromMinorityShareholders
Concept.label: Proceeds from Noncontrolling Interests
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow from a noncontrolling interest. Includes, but is not limited to, purchase of additional shares or other increase in noncontrolling interest ownership.

Children.Label: [G]Proceeds from (Repayments of) Long-Term Debt and Capital Securities
[G]Proceeds from Issuance of Long-Term Debt and Capital Securities, Net

Concept.name: ProceedsFromConvertibleDebt
Concept.label: Proceeds from Convertible Debt
Concept.description: The cash inflow from the issuance of a long-term debt instrument which can be exchanged for a specified amount of another security, typically the entity's common stock, at the option of the issuer or the holder.

Concept.name: ProceedsFromIssuanceOfLongTermDebt
Concept.label: Proceeds from Issuance of Long-term Debt
Concept.description: The cash inflow from a debt initially having maturity due after one year or beyond the operating cycle, if longer.

Concept.name: ProceedsFromRepaymentsOfLongTermDebtAndCapitalSecurities
Concept.label: Proceeds from (Repayments of) Long-term Debt and Capital Securities
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from long-term debt, including capital lease obligations and mandatory redeemable capital securities.

Children.Label: [G]Repayment of Long-Term Debt, Long-Term Lease Obligation, and Capital Security

Concept.name: FinanceLeasePrincipalPayments
Concept.label: Finance Lease, Principal Payments
Concept.description: Amount of cash outflow for principal payment on finance lease.

Concept.name: RepaymentsOfConvertibleDebt
Concept.label: Repayments of Convertible Debt
Concept.description: The cash outflow from the repayment of a long-term debt instrument which can be exchanged for a specified amount of another security, typically the entity's common stock, at the option of the issuer or the holder.

Concept.name: RepaymentsOfLongTermDebt
Concept.label: Repayments of Long-term Debt
Concept.description: The cash outflow for debt initially having maturity due after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

Concept.name: RepaymentsOfRelatedPartyDebt
Concept.label: Repayments of Related Party Debt
Concept.description: The cash outflow for the payment of a long-term borrowing made from a related party where one party can exercise control or significant influence over another party; including affiliates, owners or officers and their immediate families, pension trusts, and so forth. Alternate caption: Payments for Advances from Affiliates.

Children.Label: Proceeds From Repayments Of Other Debt

Concept.name: RepaymentsOfOtherDebt
Concept.label: Repayments of Other Debt
Concept.description: Amount of cash outflow for the payment of debt classified as other.

Concept.name: PaymentsForRepurchaseOfWarrants
Concept.label: Payments for Repurchase of Warrants
Concept.description: The aggregate amount paid by the entity to reacquire the right to purchase equity shares at a predetermined price, usually issued together with corporate debt.

Children.Label: [G]Proceeds from Issuance or Sale of Equity

Concept.name: ProceedsFromIssuanceInitialPublicOffering
Concept.label: Proceeds from Issuance Initial Public Offering
Concept.description: The cash inflow associated with the amount received from entity's first offering of stock to the public.

Concept.name: ProceedsFromIssuanceOfCommonStock
Concept.label: Proceeds from Issuance of Common Stock
Concept.description: The cash inflow from the additional capital contribution to the entity.

Concept.name: ProceedsFromIssuanceOfPrivatePlacement
Concept.label: Proceeds from Issuance of Private Placement
Concept.description: The cash inflow associated with the amount received from entity's raising of capital via private rather than public placement.

Concept.name: ProceedsFromIssuanceOfWarrants
Concept.label: Proceeds from Issuance of Warrants
Concept.description: The cash inflow from issuance of rights to purchase common shares at predetermined price (usually issued together with corporate debt).

Children.Label: [G]Cash Provided by (Used in) Investing Activity, Including Discontinued Operation

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInInvestingActivities
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Investing Activities
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from investing activities, including discontinued operations. Investing activity cash flows include making and collecting loans and acquiring and disposing of debt or equity instruments and property, plant, and equipment and other productive assets.

Children.Label: [G]Cash Provided by (Used in) Investing Activity, Continuing Operation

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInInvestingActivitiesContinuingOperations
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Investing Activities, Continuing Operations
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) of investing activities, excluding discontinued operations. Investing activity cash flows include making and collecting loans and acquiring and disposing of debt or equity instruments and property, plant, and equipment and other productive assets.

Children.Label: Payments For Proceeds From Businesses And Interest In Affiliates
[G]Payments to Acquire Businesses and Interest in Affiliates
[G]Payments to Acquire Businesses, Net of Cash Acquired

Concept.name: PaymentsToAcquireBusinessesNetOfCashAcquired
Concept.label: Payments to Acquire Businesses, Net of Cash Acquired
Concept.description: The cash outflow associated with the acquisition of a business, net of the cash acquired from the purchase.

Concept.name: PaymentsToAcquireInvestments
Concept.label: Payments to Acquire Investments
Concept.description: The cash outflow associated with the purchase of all investments (debt, security, other) during the period.

Concept.name: PaymentsToAcquireMarketableSecurities
Concept.label: Payments to Acquire Marketable Securities
Concept.description: Amount of cash outflow for purchase of marketable security.

Children.Label: [G]Proceeds from Sale, Maturity and Collection of Investments
[G]Proceeds from Sale and Maturity of Debt Securities, Available-for-Sale

Concept.name: ProceedsFromMaturitiesPrepaymentsAndCallsOfAvailableForSaleSecurities
Concept.label: Proceeds from Maturities, Prepayments and Calls of Debt Securities, Available-for-sale
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow from maturity, prepayment and call of investment in debt security measured at fair value with change in fair value recognized in other comprehensive income (available-for-sale).

Concept.name: ProceedsFromSaleAndMaturityOfMarketableSecurities
Concept.label: Proceeds from Sale and Maturity of Marketable Securities
Concept.description: The cash inflow associated with the aggregate amount received by the entity through sale or maturity of marketable securities (held-to-maturity or available-for-sale) during the period.

Concept.name: ProceedsFromSaleMaturityAndCollectionsOfInvestments
Concept.label: Proceeds from Sale, Maturity and Collection of Investments
Concept.description: The cash inflow associated with the sale, maturity and collection of all investments such as debt, security and so forth during the period.

Children.Label: Payments For Proceeds From Productive Assets

Concept.name: PaymentsToAcquireIntangibleAssets
Concept.label: Payments to Acquire Intangible Assets
Concept.description: The cash outflow to acquire asset without physical form usually arising from contractual or other legal rights, excluding goodwill.

Children.Label: [G]Payments to Acquire Property, Plant, and Equipment

Concept.name: PaymentsToAcquireLandHeldForUse
Concept.label: Payments to Acquire Land Held-for-use
Concept.description: The cash outflow for acquisition of land for use; excludes purchases of land held as inventory or as investments.

Concept.name: PaymentsToAcquirePropertyPlantAndEquipment
Concept.label: Payments to Acquire Property, Plant, and Equipment
Concept.description: The cash outflow associated with the acquisition of long-lived, physical assets that are used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services and not intended for resale; includes cash outflows to pay for construction of self-constructed assets.

Children.Label: [G]Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activity, Including Discontinued Operation

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activities
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from operating activities, including discontinued operations. Operating activity cash flows include transactions, adjustments, and changes in value not defined as investing or financing activities.

Children.Label: [G]Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activity, Continuing Operation
[G]Adjustment to Reconcile Net Income to Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activity
[G]Adjustment to Reconcile Net Income to Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activity, Noncash Item

Concept.name: AdjustmentsNoncashItemsToReconcileNetIncomeLossToCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities
Concept.label: Adjustments, Noncash Items, to Reconcile Net Income (Loss) to Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activities
Concept.description: The aggregate amount of adjustments to net income or loss necessary to remove the effects of all items whose cash effects are investing or financing cash flows. The aggregate amount also includes all noncash expenses and income items which reduce or increase net income and are thus added back or deducted when calculating cash provided by or used in operating activities.

Children.Label: [G]Amortization of Debt Issuance Costs and Discounts

Concept.name: AmortizationOfDebtDiscountPremium
Concept.label: Amortization of Debt Discount (Premium)
Concept.description: Amount of noncash expense included in interest expense to amortize debt discount and premium associated with the related debt instruments. Excludes amortization of financing costs. Alternate captions include noncash interest expense.

Concept.name: AmortizationOfFinancingCosts
Concept.label: Amortization of Debt Issuance Costs
Concept.description: Amount of amortization expense attributable to debt issuance costs.

Concept.name: AmortizationOfFinancingCostsAndDiscounts
Concept.label: Amortization of Debt Issuance Costs and Discounts
Concept.description: Amount of amortization expense attributable to debt discount (premium) and debt issuance costs.

Concept.name: DeferredIncomeTaxExpenseBenefit
Concept.label: Deferred Income Tax Expense (Benefit)
Concept.description: Amount of deferred income tax expense (benefit) pertaining to income (loss) from continuing operations.

Concept.name: InvestmentTaxCredit
Concept.label: Investment Tax Credit
Concept.description: The amount deducted from an entities' taxes, reflecting a percentage of an amount invested in certain assets spread over the useful life of those assets; includes deferred investment tax credits.

Concept.name: AmortizationOfIntangibleAssets
Concept.label: Amortization of Intangible Assets
Concept.description: The aggregate expense charged against earnings to allocate the cost of intangible assets (nonphysical assets not used in production) in a systematic and rational manner to the periods expected to benefit from such assets. As a noncash expense, this element is added back to net income when calculating cash provided by or used in operations using the indirect method.

Concept.name: ShareBasedCompensation
Concept.label: Share-based Payment Arrangement, Noncash Expense
Concept.description: Amount of noncash expense for share-based payment arrangement.

Concept.name: FairValueAdjustmentOfWarrants
Concept.label: Fair Value Adjustment of Warrants
Concept.description: Amount of expense (income) related to adjustment to fair value of warrant liability.

Concept.name: ForeignCurrencyTransactionGainLossBeforeTax
Concept.label: Foreign Currency Transaction Gain (Loss), before Tax
Concept.description: Amount before tax of foreign currency transaction realized and unrealized gain (loss) recognized in the income statement.

Children.Label: [G]Gain (Loss) on Disposition of Property Plant Equipment, Excluding Oil and Gas Property and Timber Property

Concept.name: GainLossOnDispositionOfAssets1
Concept.label: Gain (Loss) on Disposition of Assets
Concept.description: Amount of gain (loss) on sale or disposal of assets, including but not limited to property plant and equipment, intangible assets and equity in securities of subsidiaries or equity method investee.

Concept.name: GainLossOnDispositionOfIntangibleAssets
Concept.label: Gain (Loss) on Disposition of Intangible Assets
Concept.description: Amount of gain (loss) on sale or disposal of intangible assets.

Children.Label: [G]Gain (Loss) on Disposition of Property Plant Equipment

Concept.name: GainLossOnSaleOfPropertyPlantEquipment
Concept.label: Gain (Loss) on Disposition of Property Plant Equipment
Concept.description: Amount of gain (loss) on sale or disposal of property, plant and equipment assets, including oil and gas property and timber property.

Concept.name: GainsLossesOnExtinguishmentOfDebt
Concept.label: Gain (Loss) on Extinguishment of Debt
Concept.description: Difference between the fair value of payments made and the carrying amount of debt which is extinguished prior to maturity.

Concept.name: OtherNoncashIncomeExpense
Concept.label: Other Noncash Income (Expense)
Concept.description: Amount of income (expense) included in net income that results in no cash inflow (outflow), classified as other.

Concept.name: GoodwillImpairmentLoss
Concept.label: Goodwill, Impairment Loss
Concept.description: Amount of loss from the write-down of an asset representing the future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognized.

Concept.name: ImpairmentOfIntangibleAssetsIndefinitelivedExcludingGoodwill
Concept.label: Impairment of Intangible Assets, Indefinite-lived (Excluding Goodwill)
Concept.description: Amount of impairment loss resulting from write-down of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance and having a projected indefinite period of benefit to fair value.

Concept.name: PaymentsForRestructuring
Concept.label: Payments for Restructuring
Concept.description: Amount of cash payments made as the result of exit or disposal activities. Excludes payments associated with a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.

Concept.name: BusinessExitCosts1
Concept.label: Business Exit Costs
Concept.description: Amount of expenses associated with exit or disposal activities pursuant to an authorized plan. Includes, but is not limited to, one-time termination benefits, termination of an operating lease or other contract, consolidating or closing facilities, and relocating employees, and termination benefits associated with an ongoing benefit arrangement. Excludes expenses associated with special or contractual termination benefits, a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.

Concept.name: SeveranceCosts1
Concept.label: Severance Costs
Concept.description: Amount of expenses for special or contractual termination benefits provided to current employees involuntarily terminated under a benefit arrangement associated exit or disposal activities pursuant to an authorized plan. Excludes expenses related to one-time termination benefits, a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.

Concept.name: RestructuringCosts
Concept.label: Restructuring Costs
Concept.description: Amount, after cash payment, of expenses associated with exit or disposal activities pursuant to an authorized plan. Excludes expenses related to a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.

Concept.name: UnrealizedGainLossOnInvestments
Concept.label: Unrealized Gain (Loss) on Investments
Concept.description: Amount of unrealized gain (loss) on investment.

Children.Label: [G]Adjustment to Reconcile Net Income to Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activity, Increase (Decrease) in Operating Capital

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInOtherOperatingAssets
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Other Operating Assets
Concept.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in operating assets classified as other.

Children.Label: [G]Increase (Decrease) in Prepaid Expense and Other Assets

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInPrepaidDeferredExpenseAndOtherAssets
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Prepaid Expense and Other Assets
Concept.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in prepaid expenses, and assets classified as other.

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInAccountsReceivable
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Accounts Receivable
Concept.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in amount due within one year (or one business cycle) from customers for the credit sale of goods and services.

Children.Label: [G]Increase (Decrease) in Accounts Payable and Accrued Liabilities

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInAccountsPayable
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Accounts Payable
Concept.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the aggregate amount of liabilities incurred (and for which invoices have typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received that are used in an entity's business.

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInAccountsPayableAndAccruedLiabilities
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Accounts Payable and Accrued Liabilities
Concept.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the amounts payable to vendors for goods and services received and the amount of obligations and expenses incurred but not paid.

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInAccruedLiabilities
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Accrued Liabilities
Concept.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the aggregate amount of expenses incurred but not yet paid.

Concept.name: IncreaseDecreaseInDeferredRevenue
Concept.label: Increase (Decrease) in Deferred Revenue
Concept.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in deferred income and obligation to transfer product and service to customer for which consideration has been received or is receivable.

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivitiesContinuingOperations
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activities, Continuing Operations
Concept.description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from operating activities, excluding discontinued operations. Operating activity cash flows include transactions, adjustments, and changes in value not defined as investing or financing activities.

Children.Label: Net Income Loss Attributable To Reporting Entity

Concept.name: ProfitLoss
Concept.label: Net Income (Loss), Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest
Concept.description: The consolidated profit or loss for the period, net of income taxes, including the portion attributable to the noncontrolling interest.

Concept.name: CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseIncludingExchangeRateEffect
Concept.label: Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents, Period Increase (Decrease), Including Exchange Rate Effect
Concept.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in cash, cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage; including effect from exchange rate change. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Children.Label: [G]Effect of Exchange Rate on Cash, Cash Equivalent, Restricted Cash, and Restricted Cash Equivalent, Including Discontinued Operation

Concept.name: EffectOfExchangeRateOnCashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalents
Concept.label: Effect of Exchange Rate on Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents
Concept.description: Amount of increase (decrease) from effect of exchange rate changes on cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage; held in foreign currencies. Excludes amounts for disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Concept.name: EffectOfExchangeRateOnCashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsIncludingDisposalGroupAndDiscontinuedOperations
Concept.label: Effect of Exchange Rate on Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents, Including Disposal Group and Discontinued Operations
Concept.description: Amount of increase (decrease) from effect of exchange rate changes on cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage; held in foreign currencies; including, but not limited to, disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Children.Label: Statement of Cash Flows, Real Estate, Including REITs (87)

Concept.name: CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalents
Concept.label: Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents
Concept.description: Amount of cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage. Excludes amount for disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Concept.name: CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsIncludingDisposalGroupAndDiscontinuedOperations
Concept.label: Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents, Including Disposal Group and Discontinued Operations
Concept.description: Amount of cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage; including, but not limited to, disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Children.Label: [G]Cash, Cash Equivalent, Restricted Cash, and Restricted Cash Equivalent, Including Discontinued Operation

Concept.name: CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalents
Concept.label: Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents
Concept.description: Amount of cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage. Excludes amount for disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Concept.name: CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsIncludingDisposalGroupAndDiscontinuedOperations
Concept.label: Cash, Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents, Including Disposal Group and Discontinued Operations
Concept.description: Amount of cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage; including, but not limited to, disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

Children.Label: [G]Cash, Cash Equivalent, Restricted Cash, and Restricted Cash Equivalent, Period Increase (Decrease), Including Exchange Rate Effect and Discontinued Operation
[G]Cash, Cash Equivalent, Restricted Cash, and Restricted Cash Equivalent, Period Increase (Decrease), Excluding Exchange Rate Effect, Including Discontinued Operation
Net Cash Provided By Used In Discontinued Operations And Continuing Operations

Concept.name: NetCashProvidedByUsedInContinuingOperations
Concept.label: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Continuing Operations
